website_summaries.verdict: The D-Link AC1900 MU-MIMO Wi-Fi Router (DIR-878) brings dual-band Wi-Fi at an affordable price. It lacks USB connectivity, and MU-MIMO performance could be better, but it's easy to install and offers plenty of management settings.
pros: Supports Multi-User Multiple Input, Multiple Output (MU-MIMO) streaming

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended
customer_reviews.text: I have never had so many disconnects. This router is faster than my old one, but some nights I am dropping the connection from it every 10 minutes. Never had this problem with any other router I have owned. Not recommended
customer_reviews.author: wallace

customer_reviews.title: I'm done with D-Link
customer_reviews.text: lots of problems with it dropping connections and not recognizing passwords (especially in iOS devices). Sent it back and got a cheaper Netgear router that kicked it's but in both performance and setup.
customer_reviews.author: Andre Mathieu

customer_reviews.title: Drops Connection Daily
customer_reviews.text: We have had this for less than 6 months, and we have gone over on our data plan every month we've had it. The router constantly drops connections to either our phones, or our other devices. It never holds connection for everything all at once. We also can't get it to connect to both the 2g and 5g networks, we have tried tech support and just sit on hold for literal hours on end. Don't buy it, it's a waste.
customer_reviews.author: Tayler Weaver

customer_reviews.title: Pathetic excuse for a wifi router.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit to replace my Apple wifi system/network since they no longer support AirPort and I expected the technology to have improved since I installed the Apple products. Nah, Nah...this router has a range of a can of bug spray and when combined with range extenders is weak (so weak I could connect my printer to the network and use). I don't think this is worth the money and it was certainly not worth the multiple attempts to get it operational. I went back to using the Apple devices until someone tells me how to get better coverage in a 3200 sf home. Do not waste your time or money trying to get this POC to work effectively.
customer_reviews.author: peter_mac

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect with TL-WDN4800 PCI adapter in 5Ghz
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased "TP-Link Wireless Dual Band PCI Express Adapter (TL-WDN4800)", and Avent baby monitor takes 2.4ghz for its needs which interrupted and eats up my current comcast modem/router signal badly. The worst if I place the baby monitor right next the pc, I get disconnected when downloading files or taking forever to connect to the web. I have searched for some information that how to fix this right, I just needed some 5 Ghz signal for my wifi pc. my TP-Link is dual band, so I just needed dual band router which is D-Link AC1900 just works great for all. There are higher performance router available, but this works perfect and it's only $100.
customer_reviews.author: G. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I've had this product for almost week and I'm thinking this is the worst Buy I've ever made. when I first started the router and changed the password everything seemed Great, but then, the next day, my Devices wouldn't connect to the network, the Signal dimmed and the worst thing was that the password gets changed from time to time to the default password, ignoring the one I set on the initial configuration. I need to turn it off and on from time to time so that Devices are able to connect to it. not even my older 20 bucks router had this issues.
customer_reviews.author: JCS

customer_reviews.title: Constantly have to reboot
customer_reviews.text: Worst router ever, I read all the reviews before I bought it, many saying that it keeps losing connection. Sure as the 30 day return expired I'm finding myself have to oower cycle it now every couple of days. Tech support is useless, their fix is did you power cy let it, really how about you shove this router up you internet hole. For 5 years I used a Dlink router, im done with Dlink.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Fast, easy to setup, tons of options.  Excellent router!
customer_reviews.text: For those who complain that this router has a simple interface and no settings... That is only true if you just use the dlink app. Browse to the admin interface via a web browser (and if on a mobile browser, then select 'desktop') and you have tons of settings. This router is very fast, works great, and quite flexible in its quality and settings. I have been using dlink routers for at least 18 years and have never had an issue with any of them. 5 stars all the way.
customer_reviews.author: D. Curtis

customer_reviews.title: very easy install
customer_reviews.text: Nice performance, definite upgrade over my decade old linksys.....havent had to do a reset yet! Loving that! Havent noticed any slowing when everybody in the house is online with various equipment ....cell phones, laptop, wireless printer....probably shouldve got the 2200 or higher version....so wont want to upgrade quick...but the deal was so good i could not pass it by
customer_reviews.author: James Demestihas

customer_reviews.title: Failed
customer_reviews.text: I struggled with failures of wifi extenders. Come to find out it was this router that wasn't passing the internet signal from my modem to wireless devices. I spent days troubleshooting with the extender's tech support and DLink support. Not fun.
customer_reviews.author: RAM

customer_reviews.title: NOT reliable - spontaneously reboots
customer_reviews.text: The UI is fine, the performance is solid, but none of that matters because this thing is not reliable. It spontaneously reboots at least several times a week. I've tried multiple firmware versions, but it hasn't helped. This router wipes its logs after reboot (no option to save) so I have no idea what exactly is causing the reboot.
customer_reviews.author: R. Fitzpatrick

customer_reviews.title: Great router
customer_reviews.text: I needed something that could handle our foscam cameras, multiple portable devices (laptops, tablets, phones). This works well, speeds are great, our cameras pickup faster and no image issues. Easy to setup, I bought a second one for my 80+ year old mom and her Arlo Pros and portable devices and also very simple, practically plug and play.
customer_reviews.author: Majak

customer_reviews.title: This is a fantastic affordable opption for replacing whatever below average modem/router combo ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic affordable opption for replacing whatever below average modem/router combo your ISP gives you. Replaced my one from Spectrum because the signal would fluxuate... Immediately starting seeing more consistent benchmarks and could take full advantage of my service plan.
customer_reviews.author: Bcw1159185

customer_reviews.title: Works for a month then...
customer_reviews.text: I had it for a while and it works great. The range and wifi are perfect but then the signal got weaker. I had to reboot it to get my speed and wifi back. Can't return it since my window of returning it past.
customer_reviews.author: Blinkit Photography

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Absolute garbage. It is faster with better coverage than my old router. However, it drops connection constantly. I’ve tried every troubleshooting technique imaginable, and still can’t get a consistent connection. Frustrating beyond words. Wish I would have given up trying to fix it and instead returned it immediately. Spent so much time trying to get it work well that I missed the return window.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Ease and Performance
customer_reviews.text: My old Wireless WiFi Router, of 10 years, had failed so I purchased the AC1900 to replace it. I was very happy with the ease of configuration and I have noticed a marked increase in my wireless devices performance. So far I have had not complaints about the unit. I would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and easy to set up!
customer_reviews.text: Was super easy to set up, the signal is slightly better than with my former Asus router and the UI much better. It's easily handling 940mbps (I have a Comcast 1Gbps connection) which was my fear initially.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great router, love it.
customer_reviews.text: I love it, it is very much geared to be plugged in directly to your modem though. Instruction are very limited if you are using it as an AP only. We are in a medium apartment with multiple devices such as security cameras and it covers the apartment well.
customer_reviews.author: Gareth

customer_reviews.title: Super Happy so far!
customer_reviews.text: Finally got around to upgrading my home router. Too much stuff connected and previous netgear was lagging. Setup was super easy and so far all devices running smooth and fast. Not a corner of my house where signal is bad and most of my yard covered as well. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Broncorado

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't perform well
customer_reviews.text: Product firmware wasn't up to date from factory. Tech-support said I had to download three different firmware versions in order for it to run correctly (connect to wi-fi devices [experiencing connection problems], not take 15 minutes or more to scan each page). Five pages of instructions later and following on screen instructions, you still can't upgrade as the buttons on the screen don't respond. Tech support said I needed to hire a professional to do it as they can't do anything to help. It isn't worth the headache and hassle for the money. And I don't see that I can return it. Ouch!
customer_reviews.author: MDavis

customer_reviews.title: AC1900 Wireless WiFi Router
customer_reviews.text: This WiFi Dual Band Router was easy to setup and get on the air. Fast speeds and better coverage on both 2.4 and 5 GHZ bands. Very happy with the product!
customer_reviews.author: secureit

customer_reviews.title: Good Router for Price
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this router, and a modem, to save the monthly equipment rental charge through Cox. The router is currently situated on our basement and covers most of the house (basement and main floor quite well). However, we did purchase a D-Link extender for the WiFi security camera in our garage. The WiFi signal from the router had to go past several fluorescent lights and a bit of concrete/rebar.
customer_reviews.author: Connor

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: My old router kept dropping the signal. This is one of the least expensive ones I researched but so far it has not disappointed!!
customer_reviews.author: Gail C.

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up. Really good signal strength. All my wifi devices connected without any problems.
customer_reviews.author: M. Rhodes

customer_reviews.title: Good wireless router.
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm. Has great signal and speed throughout the house. Easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: Neil

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Working!!!
customer_reviews.text: The router worked well for a year but suddenly it stopped working and I am not sure how to repair it since tech support ends a couple weeks after the purchase date.
customer_reviews.author: Angel Ng

customer_reviews.title: Drops connection to tp-link smart plugs
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. Periodically and randomly drops connection with tp-link smart plugs making smart home experience terrible. Tried all solutions with both vendors and none worked. Dlink would not refund my money so will never buy another one of their products. Ended up buying a tp-link router and everything works perfectly now!!!
customer_reviews.author: scotttheman

customer_reviews.title: Not really reliable
customer_reviews.text: Devices disconnect randomly and I have to reboot the router every so often.
customer_reviews.author: A B

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in D-link
customer_reviews.text: Buying D-link products for years and this is the first product that just did not work as expected. Customer support was no use to my issue.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Alleyne

customer_reviews.title: Good router but...
customer_reviews.text: Works great after you mess with all the settings and waste about an hr... Dont expect it to work right out of the box..
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Lightning router
customer_reviews.text: Router is as fast as anything I have ever seen. We had problems with our puny router and did not realize there are Porche speed routers and there are tortoise speed routers. This D-Link is a HOT ROD.
customer_reviews.author: Desmond Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: My wife still has issues with connecting to her Samsung phone but that may be a problem with her phone. Our Roku box is 30' away and seems to have no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Jim D.

customer_reviews.title: The feature I like most on this device is that it tosses out ...
customer_reviews.text: The feature I like most on this device is that it tosses out the old school methodology of setting up specific networks. With this, you set up one network and it intelligently hands out the fastest network your device can handle... the necessity for all the antennas.
customer_reviews.author: Flying Ace

customer_reviews.title: great router
customer_reviews.text: a great upgrade from my older router, this one is more powerful and has a 5GHz band. Easy for me to set up and I get great reception all over my 3-story house (with this set on the 2nd floor) without having to resort to WiFi extenders.
customer_reviews.author: L. hitchings

customer_reviews.title: The product is satisfactory
customer_reviews.text: It works well in the house. It has superior range to other routers I've used.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen M. Rose M.S. DABR

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: Very good user support for a very good product I would recommend
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: High speeds great price!
customer_reviews.text: This product is great. Work well in my older home with plaster walls. Gets good reception through multiple walls over 50 feet away. Highly recommended. The UI for settings is slow but that’s a minor detail I only switched things there once.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Saylor

customer_reviews.title: Dropped internet connection
customer_reviews.text: Dont buy it i made the mistake of doing so for some reason the router keeps on cutting the whole damn it off and it's not my ISP I ordered a replacement and a replacement started doing the same thing after the firmware update and customer service sucks
customer_reviews.author: Omar

customer_reviews.title: Good router
customer_reviews.text: This product is easy to setup and has the power to stream video 250 ft
customer_reviews.author: Don H.

customer_reviews.title: Works, but not the easiest to set up.
customer_reviews.text: Software is horrible, but the product itself works. I'm a tech savvy millennial, but this took quite a bit of effort to get working properly.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Avoid using with Apple hardware
customer_reviews.text: Intermittent and unfixable errors with "incorrect password", DNS errors, dropped connections. Some tech support articles suggest to turn off smart connect... disabling one of the major functions of the router is not a fix!!
customer_reviews.author: C4

customer_reviews.title: Cant set diff ssid on 2. 4 and 5 ...
customer_reviews.text: Cant set diff ssid on 2.4 and 5 ghz networks. Does everything else i want. And very well i might add. Doesnt do 10Gb
customer_reviews.author: RaVell

customer_reviews.title: Issues
customer_reviews.text: Nothing but ossues for 7 months and now it's completely dead. Wouldn't but again!
customer_reviews.author: Mandi

customer_reviews.title: not good
customer_reviews.text: not working properly i just realize that it's giving me the what i expect
customer_reviews.author: untitled fox

customer_reviews.title: Best router i've have
customer_reviews.text: With my other router (the one who give the company) i never have signal, with this router i even have in the yard and give me the exact speed i have contracted
customer_reviews.author: Franco Zúñiga

customer_reviews.title: Nice and easy
customer_reviews.text: Nice router, easy to setup. Good coverage throughout my apt.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry L. Kerns

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Turn on, simple configuration, on line in less than 10 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Shaferkd

customer_reviews.title: and smart devices such as plugs
customer_reviews.text: Works well in house with lots of competition for wifi from computers, tablets, phones, and smart devices such as plugs, fans, thermostat, and switches. Home is one level 2400 square feet and does not require a range extender.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up. Good buy. I would not hesitate to buy this again if I needed another
customer_reviews.author: Mike Massey

customer_reviews.title: skip it.
customer_reviews.text: don't bother. Could not keep connection, went in to endless cycle of asking to be reinstalled. Worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony L Zurlo

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful
customer_reviews.text: This router was very easy to install and setup the management. It is a lot more powerful then the other router provided by my ISP.
customer_reviews.author: Lambert W. Badgett

customer_reviews.title: the router was good for the first two months and now i have ...
customer_reviews.text: the router was good for the first two months and now i have to reset it every day and my laptop and phone still struggle to connect
customer_reviews.author: Adam Skelton

customer_reviews.title: Its is really esay to to install.
customer_reviews.text: Really great router it's able to cover my whole house plus about 30 away from my house and my home is 1800 square feet
customer_reviews.author: lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Cheap technology
customer_reviews.text: Cuts out ALOT and constantly asks says wrong password on my devices and then accepts them after a few attempts. Absolutely a pain. I end up in house tech support for my whole family to re connect them to internet over and over. I’ll be buying a nother router unfortunately
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Works great, tv dvd stereo wii Xbox
customer_reviews.text: Works great, tv dvd stereo wii Xbox, sat reciever, a couple of other small devices are all running, and still no lag in playing videos or games
customer_reviews.author: shane rosecrans

customer_reviews.title: Crap!!!
customer_reviews.text: Lasted just over the return limit and took a dump! Worst product ever!
customer_reviews.author: Alfredo Moran

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: Have only had it 2 months and router has been corrupted by a virus. Can not get the virus off. Firmware has not been updated by company.
customer_reviews.author: anonymity

customer_reviews.title: Lacks ease of use features competitors have
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to use this as an access point. apparently this is possible but unlike other routers produced by D-links competitors there is no option for this in the routers settings which makes this easy and doable for the average user. if you understand routers and networking as well as someone working in IT I'm sure this would be a breeze to do by following instructions on the website. Not easy for me enough to figure out with the instructions on D-links forum. I suppose I should have bought another net gear.
customer_reviews.author: Shaq_Train

customer_reviews.title: Avoid if you own a PS4
customer_reviews.text: Avoid if you own a PS4. Newer firmware breaks the connection between the DIR-878 and the PS4.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: My old router was more than 10 years old. My laptop responds faster with the new router. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely performs as promised. Great product at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: I need amplify WiFi in second floor at my home
customer_reviews.author: José A.

customer_reviews.title: Decent router, one issue.
customer_reviews.text: This router was a breeze to set up. Fool proof setup. Almost unsettling how easy and simple the setup is. Range is a little better than my old d link. Really wish it had an accompanying app for remote management like my old d link cloud router. I liked having the ability to reboot remotely and monitor connected devices. Should be standard, especially at this price range.
customer_reviews.author: David H

customer_reviews.title: Extremely poor performance even after hours of configuring options and channels
customer_reviews.text: I got this router to upgrade my connection. The result was absolutely awful. I have 300 mbps coming in and connected through the router over 200 of those just disapear. The results were appaling over wifi. I returned this and swapped it out for the Asus AC86U and my speed through wireless tripled. Extremely poor performance even after hours of configuring options and channels.
customer_reviews.author: Adrien DE LA TOUR

customer_reviews.title: The speed for a direct line computer is fantastic! RokuTVs work fine and then some
customer_reviews.text: The speed for a direct line computer is fantastic! RokuTVs work fine and then some! But... I have a Dlink cam and a Echo Dot. They both d/c a lot. I just spent 4 hours reconnecting them. The help section says to use the 5gh wifi, but there isn't a link the the directions on how to do this. The manual doesn't spell it out either. AND unplugging everything to make it work every day is a HUGE pita. SO.. WTF did I pay for? A $119 door stop? Come on DLink. Quit ripping USA off!
customer_reviews.author: Shopping Mom

product_meta.title: D-Link WiFi Smart Router AC1900 Wireless Dual Band MU-MIMO Powerful Dual Core Processor Fast Gaming & 4K Streaming Reliable Coverage (DIR-878), Black
product_meta.description:
The AC1900 MU-MIMO WiFi Router delivers premium performance for today’s most demanding tasks: HD streaming, gaming, and multiple device usage. It comes packed with speeds of up to 1,900 Mbps (600 Mbps in 2.4GHz + 1,300 Mbps in 5GHz ), a high-performance dual-core processor, AC Smart Beam Technology, Intelligent Quality of Service (QoS) with traffic prioritization, four high-performance external antennas for maximum range, a new user interface, Smart Connect and with an easy setup. The DIR-878 is the perfect combination of performance and ease of use.

The AC1900 Wireless Router comes with 3x3 data streams which can support faster Wi-Fi speeds. These streams can be combined through beamforming and MU-MIMO to increase reliability and range. This 3x3 AC router is the latest in AC technology, delivering independent data streams to devices on the network for speeds of up to 1,900 Mbps. The AC1900 helps provide the best overall performance to single devices that require high bandwidth such as video streaming or online gaming.

The DIR-878 is designed to support MU-MIMO (Multi-User Multiple Input Multiple Output) technology that allows multiple devices to get high-bandwidth Wi-Fi signal at the same time. You can stream HD media faster and play lag-free gaming. Compared to SU-MIMO(Single-User Multiple Input Multiple Output) technology, MU-MIMO distributes data more efficiently, giving you the fastest Wi-Fi speeds in your home. The DIR-878 internet router also comes with four high-performance antennas to deliver maximum range around your home and yard.
feature_bullets: Stream, game, and more: Enjoy 4K/HD video and online gaming simultaneously with 3x3 data streams and 4 high performance antennas
Dual Core Processor: The dual Core Processor gives you powerful wired and wireless network speeds
Multi user MIMO technology: Significantly improves simultaneous streaming on multiple devices
Advanced Smart Beam: Tracks your connected devices for enhanced Wi-Fi speed and range throughout your home
Advanced quality of service: Bandwidth optimization through client prioritization
Connect securely: Supports WPA/WPA2 encryption for home network security
Intuitive user interface: Easy setup from your mobile devices and network management from your desktop

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars314 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
